name: places/ChIJnWnw8FNYwokRM_ANpHNp7Dw
formattedAddress: 336 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 336 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036-3884, USA

originalText.text:
Attended this last year with my 16 year old son on the last performance of the evening, we enjoyed every minute, not every comedian was our type of humour, but respect the craft.

Not sure about the complaints about having too buy drinks during the show, venue needs to make it's money.

As it was the last performance, was a nice touch to talk to a few of the acts and the host afterwards. Respect from the UK.

originalText.text:
After finding out that the LOL Times Square Comedy Club DOESN'T EXIST ANYMORE! we walked through the cold to this location, desperate to find any show at all.  We almost gave up because there's an outdoor dining structure in front of the club that blocks the view from the north side of the street.  Luckily, the 7 PM show hadn't started yet, and we got some seats at the back of the room.  We didn't use discount or advance tickets and paid $30 apiece at the door.  They were very clear about the additional 2-drink minimum before we paid.  There's also a big sign out front (see photo) about the minimum.  If that's a problem, you can get 2 soft drinks for $6 each, so the per-person spend is $42.   Considering it's in the center of the most expensive city in the world and Broadway shows charge hundreds of dollars, that's cheap.  Deal with it.

Now, the show.

There were 4 stand-up comedians plus an emcee, in a small room with a low ceiling, cozy but not dilapidated, with room for about 50 people.  Comedy at this price level is always going to be a crapshoot, with some marginal talents offset by others who might be going places.  The MC was personable, improvised well with the audience.  None of the comics were bad, they all had different styles and at least a few laughs each.  It's actually fun to see how different people are developing compared to each other.  The last guy was truly good, and the only woman in the set was interesting and funny.  Your results may differ--it all depends on who they book that night, and big names aren't going to play a small place like this.  Give it a try and loosen up!

Our experience was marred a little bit by a couple who came in after us, and after they got their first drinks didn't want to get seconds.  So the manager tried to explain the two-drink minimum, while the show was going on, and the couple eventually left in a huff.  We almost were ready to pay for their drinks so we could see the show.

originalText.text: Honestly have never laughed so hard in my entire life. The comedians would make fun of some audience members but it was all in good fun and everyone had a good time! We went on a Thursday at 11 PM and had like 14 others with us in the crowd which was great! One complaint would be drink prices but this is NYC so that is something normal around here. Definitely recommend! You wonâ€™t regret it!

originalText.text: It was fine. Mostly just slightly-funny comedians trying to make jokes about the audience and the jokes falling flat. But at least my mandatory $15 daiquiri helped keep it interesting!

text.text: It was fine. Mostly just slightly-funny comedians trying to make jokes about the audience and the jokes falling flat. But at least my mandatory $15 daiquiri helped keep it interesting!

originalText.text:
The host and comedians were funny. Even the Jewish boy who was so nervous. Respect for at least trying ðŸ˜„. Playboy Jack was the best of all evening.

Drinks are ridiculous expensive and cocktails disgusting too and the waitress put 15% tip on your tab without asking. I find that very greedy and rude. We always give tips, but it is a customers choice and you should not force that upon someone.

We will not be attending again when visiting NYC.
